text:
Howdy from Austin, TX, USA.

My name's Chris, and I'm a software engineer at a SaaS company with a little background in graphic design and product design. As such, my coding experience is mostly front-end, UI stuff; and I'm really interested in usability, shortening feedback loops for users and developers, and what makes the real world so much more satisfying than the current digital landscape.

My love of programming started with trying to make games in Basic, but I haven't developed in that area since age 12.

My guiding principle is making the whole world customizable and mutable for everyone. Then reality would be a more accurate reflection of what people love instead of what they're stuck with. That encompasses arts, crafts, politics, and all creative disciplines - including programming.

As such, my coding experience is mostly front-end, UI stuff; and I'm really interested in usability, shortening feedback loops for users and developers, and what makes the real world so much more satisfying than the current digital landscape.

My guiding principle is making the whole world customizable and mutable for everyone. Then reality would be a more accurate reflection of what people love instead of what they're stuck with. That encompasses arts, crafts, politics, and all creative disciplines - including programming.

text:
Hey there, I am Yurii. I am a founder at Omnigres (short spoiler: Postgres as an Application Runtime). I am very fond of continuous exploration of the computing and programming space, and I have a wide range of interests and skills: anywhere from MUMPS to Lisp, C to Rust, Prolog to SQL, you name it. I am also very interested in popularizing the lesser-known but great concepts that lead to better software (when I have the energy and inspiration for that!) – I’ve been at it professional over 20 years (and a bit more if I can count my earlier days.

I am based out of beautiful Vancouver Island in Canada and love the outdoors, [marathon] running, and a few other things.
